intro: Synotis tetrantha, commonly known as the four-stemmed synotis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in woodland or swampy areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
